    • Method Detail

      • createId

        public int createId()
        Creates a new ID for the job info. Can be overridden if you need to provide different ids not to conflict with the rest of your application.
        Returns:
        A unique integer id for the next Job request to be sent to system scheduler

      • request

        public void request(SchedulerConstraint constraint)
        Specified by:
        request in class Scheduler

      • getExecutionWindowSizeInSeconds

        public long getExecutionWindowSizeInSeconds()
        GCMNetworkManager accepts an execution window for jobs so that it can batch them together for better battery utilization. You can override this method to provide a different execution window. The default value is BatchingScheduler.DEFAULT_BATCHING_PERIOD_IN_MS (converted to seconds).
        Returns:
        The execution window time for the Job request

        public void cancelAll()
        Description copied from class: Scheduler
        When called, should cancel all pending jobs

        cancelAll in class Scheduler

        public void onFinished(SchedulerConstraint constraint,
              boolean reschedule)
        Description copied from class: Scheduler
        Called by the JobManager when a scheduled constraint is handled.
        Specified by:
        onFinished in class Scheduler
        Parameters:
        constraint - The original constraint
        reschedule - True if the job should be rescheduled
